dispatch.translation[0].definitions[0].d: to send someone or something somewhere for a particular purpose
dispatch.translation[0].definitions[0].e: Goods are normally dispatched within 24 hours.
A reporter was dispatched to Naples to cover the riot.
dispatch.translation[0].definitions[1].d: to deal with someone or to finish a job quickly and effectively
dispatch.translation[0].definitions[2].d: to deliberately kill a person or animal
dispatch.translation[1].definitions[0].d: a message sent between military or government officials
dispatch.translation[1].definitions[1].d: a report sent to a newspaper from one of its writers who is in another town or country
dispatch.translation[1].definitions[2].d: the act of sending people or things to a particular place
dispatch.translation[1].definitions[2].e: the dispatch of warships to the region
dispatch.translation[2].definitions[0].d: to send something or someone to a place
dispatch.translation[2].definitions[0].e: Manufacturers dispatch vials of vaccine in large, insulated cartons.
A rescue team was dispatched to the mountain.
